issue.title: DR 704 removes complexity guarantee for clear()

discussion.p: Were we aware that the resolution to LWG means there is no complexity guarantee for clear() on most sequence containers? Previously it was implied by defining it in terms of erase(begin(), end()) but we no longer do that.
There are explicit complexity requirements for std::list::clear(), but not the other sequence containers.

The idea was that the notion of "destroys all elements in a" would imply a linear complexity, but the wording needs to be clearer, because this doesn't say that this step is the actual complexity bound.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N3485.
